column4: 1. If you had moments of joy or satisfaction at PMCC please tell us why you felt that way.
column5: 1-1. If PMCC activities provided new insights or inspiration in your daily life what part of the conversation was it?
column7: 2-1. Which part of PMCC's philosophy do you resonate with most? Please freely share your thoughts!
column8: 2-2. How much would you recommend this philosophy (value) to your friends? Why do you want to invite your friends to PMCC?
column9: 2-3. Do you want to continue participating in PMCC activities in the future?
column10: 3. If there are areas PMCC should improve to provide a better community experience please let us know!
column11: 4. Below are projects PMCC is planning. Which sessions are you interested in? Which projects would you attend? (Multiple choice)
column12: 4. Below are projects PMCC is planning. Which sessions are you interested in? Which projects would you attend? (Multiple choice) (2)

column4: The time drinking coffee and listening to the lives and attitudes of various people was very beneficial. It was a time that brought vitality to my boring life.
column5: While listening to stories from various occupations, I indirectly experienced lives I haven't experienced. Furthermore, I personally had time to imagine the future, which was very interesting.
column7: I strongly resonate with the aspect of connection. Regardless of age and gender, everyone became peers at PMCC, and we could feel psychological satisfaction by telling our own stories and listening to others.
column8: I want to instill new insights to friends around me who have rigid thinking.
column10: I hope more promotion is done so that not only members' acquaintances but also various other people can participate.
column12: Nature exploration running sessions (nature-friendly activities such as Namsan's hidden rough mountain trails and Bukaksan trail running)

column4: - The refreshing feeling of running on Sunday morning. The happiness of being able to share this refreshment with people together. - Indirect experiences through conversations with people from various fields (carpenter, yoga instructor, doctor). - During coffee sessions, the conversations about content I never thought of sparked interest, and formed consensus about similar worries/thoughts.
column5: Thoughts about the future and career / thoughts about well-being. * Where do we get happiness from? * I want to do so many things but time is finite. * Loose solidarity.
column7: 'Deeply understanding each other'. It is quite difficult to truly understand. The process of trying to understand each other more in a comfortable atmosphere of respect through running and coffee sessions, and the philosophy of achieving genuine connection rather than one-time meetings through this process resonates with me.
column8: Highly recommend. * Sharing the refreshing Sunday morning together. * Mutual motivation through connection with people from various fields who want to live healthy lives. * Comfortable atmosphere where each person's diversity is respected.
column10: It might be a good try to throw out a 'topic' to talk about during coffee sessions. (Of course, talking about each person's thoughts and concerns now is also good).
column12: Nature exploration running sessions (nature-friendly activities such as Namsan's hidden rough mountain trails and Bukaksan trail running)

column4: Being able to feel and share the way of life and current concerns and values of various friends.
column5: There are various ways of living and unique methods of each person!
column7: Achieving genuine connection.
column8: I want to connect many good people.
column10: Opening an easy-to-manage open chat room and selecting dates and times when more people can participate through voting on running dates would be good!
column12: Cohort learning projects in various fields (4-week personal writing project, design process development project, personal branding, exhibition studies, cafe tours and space studies, etc.)

column4: It was good to have the experience of being able to naturally talk about each other's stories, starting with talking about the course we experienced together that day and how today's running was, rather than just focusing on running. The common experience seemed to give us a sense of bonding.
column5: I could talk about various things with friends of my generation living in the same era about what thoughts they have these days. (Actually everything was good ??All conversations were meaningful,,)
column7: 'Deeply understanding each other' Through the 'common experience' of running, I experienced becoming curious about the companions who ran with me today. The connection that comes from loose solidarity, which is not complicated and without tension, seemed to make my story and others' stories more honest.
column8: I want to recommend it to friends who want to experience new networking.
column10: As I lack experience with other communities to compare... I'll think more about the answer to this question!
column12: Nature exploration running sessions (nature-friendly activities such as Namsan's hidden rough mountain trails and Bukaksan trail running)

column4: - When introducing myself, I didn't feel like starting with social status like soldier/office worker. - I also like Seoul, and morning Seoul is the best. - The gathering is healthy and sound. - I have so many things I want to do outside of work, but I'll probably stay at this company for about 20 years. Just meeting these people feels like preparing for my second life (because I'm very curious about and looking forward to the members' futures).
column5: The very fact that we created a community by naming a pure gathering that wasn't for profit, to learn something, or to get help. The very fact that there's a friend who reached out to be together.
column7: I understood it as 'let's be friends'. Good.
column8: It reminds me of Baek Se-hyeon.
column10: (Let me think about it)

column4: When I feel the walls between us thinning while running together.
column5: I receive insights not only from other people's conversation topics, but also from their speaking manners and considerate attitudes toward others.
column7: The part about achieving genuine connection seems to be what needs the most attention going forward. Whether to do some business together through connection, create programs to connect members, or create your own brand through advertising revenue and profits, etc.
column8: I think inspiration isn't only necessary for people who do art. Inspiration is always needed for the direction of our lives, but I think it can't be received just because someone intends it, so I want to give many opportunities to receive inspiration.
column10: Just as an idea... how about creating several more routes to run in various places and go to new places after that?

column4: When everyone is satisfied, I am also satisfied. Although I'm a participant, I'm with the mindset of an owner. I'll extract my satisfaction and joy by myself.
column5: It gives me energy. Everyone there is amazing. I'm so lacking that I think I'll have to work hard to match up with those people.
column6: I think it's enough distance to feel each other's breathing when running together and matching rhythms. The moment when out-of-breath exhalations mix with mine, the worried sighs when facing uphill, the relieved sighs when facing downhill. The harmony of these carbon dioxides... How beautiful is the moment when joys and sorrows meet?
column7: I recommend it. We're more similar than we think. If it's good for me, it will be good for my friends too.
column9: It would be better if there were shower rooms, locker rooms, shuttle buses, various drinks, refreshments, and a more wonderful me..
column10: Creative sharing (expressing and sharing your own running and daily experiences through writing, drawing, photography, music, etc.), Cohort learning projects in various fields (4-week personal writing project, design process development, personal branding, exhibition studies, cafe tours and space studies, etc.), Ideation Session where specific topics are pre-selected and discussed in depth

column4: When I felt the walls with other people breaking down in the process of running together, I liked being able to learn positive life attitudes by listening to the philosophies of myself and others while talking with them in the coffee session.
column5: 1. I should try writing a diary every day. When meeting someone with a different attitude from me, the enlightenment and self-reflection gained at that moment often disappears when the encounter ends, but I want to keep giving myself positive energy by reviewing the points I felt at that moment. As a means to do that, I should write a diary so I can reflect back on that time and learn from my past self even in the distant future. (Stories about discovering current concerns in past diaries, attitude of continuously taking notes of inspiration during conversations) 2. To be satisfied with what I like itself without comparing with others, I need an experience of extreme immersion, which requires effort to focus on what I like. Let's focus on one thing. (From stories about exercise experiences) 3. Inferiority complex is healthy. I must face my shortcomings and use them as opportunities for growth. Let's face our shortcomings. (From the story that passion arises from inferiority complex and desire)
column7: The time spent sweating with people together seems to help people who don't know each other get closer. I think the three philosophies are deeply connected, and I think long-term interaction is necessary to achieve the third goal. Each meeting time doesn't need to be long, but if meeting opportunities continue long-term and we can share life problems, concerns, and inspirations during that process, we can achieve genuine connection.
column8: I think people need a group they can rely on. There may be cases when they can't rely on family, so I think the more such groups there are, the better. Individuals belonging to a group with a culture of listening will feel understood and accepted by that group and will be able to rely on that group. I have a desire to introduce such a support to my friends.
column10: ?ëç I'll think more while participating more.
column11: Cohort learning projects in various fields (4-week personal writing project, design process development, personal branding, exhibition studies, cafe tours and space studies, etc.)

column4: While running, at some point I became curious about the person next to me. I'm usually not curious about people. That in itself was already a big event for me..!
column5: When talking about each other's passions, and hearing experiences of turning it into something continuous rather than just a momentary emotion, I wanted to apply it to my own life. And also lifestyles I can't meet in my small world! An experience that broadens thinking.
column7: 'Breaking down physical and mental walls' while strangers. Such a precious experience.
column8: I don't want to invite just anyone, but I'm convinced this can help many people. So many of my peers who are lonely and lost!
column10: I'll observe closely and talk without reservation when I think of something. Nothing yet.
column11: Nature exploration running sessions (nature-friendly activities such as Namsan's hidden rough mountain trails and Bukaksan trail running)

column4: #NAME?
column5: Sharing each other's concerns and talking comfortably was good! Usually many gatherings are uncomfortable and cautious, so we mainly have only superficial talks before parting, but at PMCC, I could hear the inner stories of each person, so even if it was the first time meeting, they remained more vividly in memory!
column7: Deeply understanding each other. Don't you think if we only emphasize 'sameness with me' while living, the understanding heart gradually disappears? I think a lot these days. The love felt when meeting people with various thoughts and understanding them had been forgotten a lot, but thanks to PMCC, it seemed to have awakened a bit!
column8: I think I would recommend it to friends who want to live life rather than just survive, or friends who want to get insights while being healthy!
column10: I think you're doing well! I expect you'll continue to build up steadily and become clearer and grow more! I think highly of the fact that you've started, are practicing, and are implementing! I think you'll become an even better community if you don't forget sincerity-diligence-passion as you are now!
column11: Nature exploration running sessions (nature-friendly activities such as Namsan's hidden rough mountain trails and Bukaksan trail running)

column4: It was good that young people of similar age could share their precious values, not just exercise.
column5: It was good to listen attentively to the thoughts of truly various young people, and I learned what communication is by having them focus and listen when I speak, which I had forgotten.
column6: The value of running together. I feel that life is not about living alone, but that we can develop more when we move forward matching steps together.
column7: There are so many values that make life healthy, not just the goal of becoming healthy through exercise, so I think I can confidently introduce it to precious people around me.
column9: For invited members, I give a small opinion that it would be good if hopeful regular members provide drinks, etc. with a small membership fee~
column10: Nature exploration running sessions (nature-friendly activities such as Namsan's hidden rough mountain trails and Bukaksan trail running)

column4: At first it's awkward, but during running when you're out of breath and say a few words, before you know it you're breathing and chattering excitedly. I think I enjoyed it because I felt a comfort I've never felt anywhere else.
column5: The fact that other people also worry. I thought only I worried and only I was lacking, but as we opened up and shared our concerns with each other, I gained more courage and strength.
column7: Deep connection! Conversation from deep in the heart rather than superficial small talk. One star is left for the possibility that PMCC's values will develop and improve.
column8: Very recommend. But I only want to invite those who are ready to listen to others' stories.
column10: Sunday sessions are so good. I think it would be good to communicate and talk a bit more even while we spend our busy weekdays... + 4. I'm looking forward to various programs.
column11: Creative sharing (expressing and sharing your own running and daily experiences through writing, drawing, photography, music, etc.), Cohort learning projects in various fields (4-week personal writing project, design process development, personal branding, exhibition studies, cafe tours and space studies, etc.)

column4: Since it was my second participation, comparison with the first was possible, and it was fun that different shapes came out depending on the member composition.
column5: Hearing about Coupang founder's words. Story about beginners, intermediates, and experts in entrepreneurship.
column7: The advantage of loose solidarity, so being able to speak more easily.
column8: If there's an opportunity, I want to bring more interesting friends.
column10: Not right now, but I was concerned that as time passes, loose solidarity may actually become solid solidarity and may not look like what it is now.
column11: Nature exploration running sessions (nature-friendly activities such as Namsan's hidden rough mountain trails and Bukaksan trail running)

column4: 1. When feeling resonance with others, when I felt that they have the same concerns as me yet are living their own lives. 2. When running and feeling good fatigue. 3. When listening to various lives and stories from various occupations, it felt like indirectly experiencing a new world. 4. When I felt a sense of belonging.
column7: Genuine connection.
column8: Strong recommendation. Because I want to live like that.
column11: Ideation Session where specific topics are pre-selected and discussed in depth, Cohort learning projects in various fields (4-week personal writing project, design process development, personal branding, exhibition studies, cafe tours and space studies, etc.)

column4: Body and mind become healthy through exercise, and when drinking coffee and talking, we talk with healthier thoughts, so I'm very satisfied with this part.
column5: Originally I didn't like conversations with people that much and felt it consumed emotions, but I learned it's different when I talk with people who are similar to me. Rather, I gain good synergy.
column6: I resonated a lot with genuine connection. I empathize a lot when talking with people. I think empathy is the best way to get close to people.
column7: I want to recommend it a lot. My personal thought is that there are many various people in the world. So it's hard to find people with similar vibes. Even if I want to invite them, I'd be so sad if they come and don't find it fun...
column9: It will proceed in the future, but I think it would be good to have a bit more SNS activity.
column10: Nature exploration running sessions (nature-friendly activities such as Namsan's hidden rough mountain trails and Bukaksan trail running), Ideation Session where specific topics are pre-selected and discussed in depth

column4: I was satisfied from the start with a healthy weekend morning, and gained motivation to live harder while communicating with people.
column5: After hearing education-related content, I thought about what kind of appearance I should show to my 7-year-old niece who I live with! (interest)
column7: Genuine connection. Because there's a limit to what I can think of alone!
column8: I want my friends around to also receive the great positive energy gained from conversations with people.
column10: Although I only participated once..! For 'continuously' more willingness to participate... It would be good to also have a conversational space where we share what changes have started to happen with the positive energy received and what 'actions' we came to do.
column11: Creative sharing (expressing and sharing your own running and daily experiences through writing, drawing, photography, music, etc.), Nature exploration running sessions (nature-friendly activities such as Namsan's hidden rough mountain trails and Bukaksan trail running)

column4: First, I was very satisfied with the opportunity to refresh my mind through running. I was proud of myself for running a distance I would have definitely stopped in the middle of if I had run alone. Above all, I hadn't had a chance to empty my mind for the past few months, but I'm satisfied that I ran with truly no thoughts around the halfway point of running. Second, I gained comfort through a sense of homogeneity in the place where we had conversations. There aren't many places where people can have somewhat deep conversations, and I was comforted by the fact that so many people who think similarly at a similar depth gathered like this.
column5: Regarding 'why' we do something, I thought I definitely live with beliefs when I heard that beliefs are emphasized, but as time passes, I feel the need to specify what beliefs I have. I realize I'm in a vague state where I can't express it accurately even though it's an important element that makes up who I am, so I think more deeply about what my beliefs are.
column6: I most resonate with achieving genuine connection. Perhaps the fact that we're creating one connection point by investing one morning to many people living apart in the world feels very valuable.
column7: Regarding this, I think it really varies by person. When I think of friends around me, there are also many people who pursue only superficial things and think only about their surroundings, so I want to recommend it to people who can truly understand this value.
column8: I was very satisfied with my first participation. Personally, what I'm curious about is: if I continue participating, won't the conversation topics revolve around the attending people? If so, I'm curious about the operator's plan for how to expand those topics outward.
column9: Creative sharing (expressing and sharing your own running and daily experiences through writing, drawing, photography, music, etc.), Ideation Session where specific topics are pre-selected and discussed in depth

column4: 1. The part about talking while running. I was worried it wouldn't allow concentration, but the stories shared while sweating had a subtle charm.
column5: Though we're all running the same, everyone's thoughts are different, and the range of thinking seems to have broadened.
column7: Running together. Perhaps we can never understand each other, but the fact that we can run together seems meaningful.
column8: By expressing one's story candidly, it seems we can look back at ourselves once more.
column10: It might be good to meet by setting a theme for the conversation once in a while :) ex) Favorite movie and reasons, etc.
column11: Ideation Session where specific topics are pre-selected and discussed in depth

column4: I was satisfied because I could push to my limits and run because we ran together. I enjoyed the place where we shared concerns, thoughts, and experiences about life from various people.
column5: I could gain insights about how to ask for favors.
column7: 'Running together' - It seems the value of community and cooperation is disappearing in society. Just by gathering and running together with people from various backgrounds, we can feel the preciousness of the values of community and cooperation.
column8: Strongly recommend. It seems it will be a place where we can exercise for health together and naturally talk about current concerns.
column10: When there are many people, it would be good to divide into appropriate numbers to conduct conversation sessions.
column11: Nature exploration running sessions (nature-friendly activities such as Namsan's hidden rough mountain trails and Bukaksan trail running), Ideation Session where specific topics are pre-selected and discussed in depth

column4: Running while matching pace. Not going fast, but going together steadily.
column5: Even my current self is just a process. Even if life's direction draws curves rather than a straight line, with the heart of a traveler sailing that path.
column7: Running together- Like running while being considerate, it becomes a time to organize thoughts to express my thoughts better and adjust the breathing of thoughts through conversation with others.
column8: Because not only physical/mental healthy pleasure but also networking with people in other fields beyond my world and expansion of knowledge is possible.
column10: Diversity of courses.
column11: Creative sharing (expressing and sharing your own running and daily experiences through writing, drawing, photography, music, etc.), Cohort learning projects in various fields (4-week personal writing project, design process development, personal branding, exhibition studies, cafe tours and space studies, etc.), Ideation Session where specific topics are pre-selected and discussed in depth

column4: First, it was good to be able to feel again the feeling of running together breathing and running the same path together. And in the coffee session, I spoke near the beginning and talked about a concern that wasn't a concern, and I was surprised and moved by how people who spoke after seriously and deeply accepted and talked about my concern with their honest thoughts.
column5: 'Gang Byeong-chan' talked about how he is someone who achieved 'passion-career match,' but the difficulties that come from it were fresh and his story was very interesting. I always tried to do work I liked, but I thought that might not be the answer, and on the other hand, it was a moment of receiving comfort and feeling at ease in my heart as someone who always worried and struggled in that aspect.
column7: First, I deeply resonate with the part about 'running together.' I also fully resonate with the values that come after, but I'm confident I'll feel them even more strongly after some more time passes while continuing to participate in this community. The process of focusing on each other's breathing through 'running together,' pulling and being pulled by each other when tired and exhausted while conversing, is very good and I think it's one of the true meanings of running.
column8: I naturally want others to also feel these values. I have no doubt that those who truly resonate with these values and run together will give great strength to this community. I hope many people who know the joy of running together increase.
column9: I'll improve on what needs improvement while participating more. First, when running together, there were cases where instead of running in two columns, people ran in groups of three, two, or four in a disorderly manner. When that happened, there were definitely people who were left out, people who ran alone, and there's concern it could harm other runners in terms of running manners. It's too good to match up with new people and run while talking after a brief rest in the middle of running, but I hope it happens within the rule of two columns.
column10: Ideation Session where specific topics are pre-selected and discussed in depth, Nature exploration running sessions (nature-friendly activities such as Namsan's hidden rough mountain trails and Bukaksan trail running)

column4: We endlessly face crossroads in life, but I'm busy avoiding them. I want to turn away because I'm afraid to decide. PMCC didn't decide anything for me. It didn't rush me or push my back. But it turned on the switch that creates the harmony of reason and emotion that I usually turned off and lived with. If flowers are results and stems are processes, I experienced choosing good seeds and planting them together here.
column5: That you don't have to make what you like into your work. It was a problem I was suffering from alone. I thought I was young and had a wide range of choices, yet worry preceded and I couldn't decide anything thinking 'is this okay like this.' I felt with my skin how great sharing experiences is. 'I don't have to worry, there are many people who have already had such experiences,' I'm in the process of making plans more concrete.
column7: Sorry.
column8: Going to Japan now haha.
column10: If the number of participants increases more than now, it might be good to divide into Saturday and Sunday groups to proceed. If we limit the number of people who can participate in one day, we can experience deeper communication time.
column11: Creative sharing (expressing and sharing your own running and daily experiences through writing, drawing, photography, music, etc.), Cohort learning projects in various fields (4-week personal writing project, design process development, personal branding, exhibition studies, cafe tours and space studies, etc.)

column4: I feel the joy of being together after a long time. When life gets busy, we can't take care of surrounding things well. That's because they all approach as burdens. PMCC gives the comfort that comes from a gathering without burden. Nevertheless, we care for someone we meet for the first time under the name of companion.
column5: Story of work we want to do and work we must do. The shining eyes of companions who recently discharged from military became inspiration.
column7: I greatly resonate with the value of community.
column8: When you do physical and intellectual activities in succession, your mind feels clear. Especially for me, it was quite a big challenge, so there's also pride.
column10: In the case of mountain courses (where you have to walk), it might be good to exclude them from the route.
column11: Nature exploration running sessions (nature-friendly activities such as Namsan's hidden rough mountain trails and Bukaksan trail running)

column5: Gang Byeong-chan's mushroom story.
column7: Running together.

column4: It was good to do warm-up exercises.

column4: All moments like the moment I woke up in the morning, the moment I finished running to the end, etc. were enjoyable and I could feel satisfaction even in myself.
column5: At a time when I'm facing employment with many concerns, after talking, I felt my perspective was too narrow, and I gained inspiration that I should do self-development for my life and myself, not self-development for employment.
column7: 'Running together' The experience itself of running while matching breathing, being considerate of and cheering each other is precious and valuable.
column8: Because it's a community that provides opportunities for various people to meet, I want to share the experience of meeting friends facing concerns about life and sharing various insights.
column10: Perhaps because there were many people? (it might have felt more so because tables were separated) I felt a bit regretful that I couldn't talk with everyone. I thought it would also be good to have a space where we can all sit together in a circle, or to proceed by dividing by region if the community grows bigger. Of course, today was also very good~~!!

column4: Meeting new people! I received fresh and positive stimulation.
column5: One participant's words about feeling satisfaction from sustainable happiness lingered until the evening of the day I returned, so I think I received a lot of inspiration.
column7: Understanding. Listening.
column8: Yes.

column4: I felt rewarded feeling the distance steadily increase while running and talking happily.
column5: I could feel each person's concerns.
column6: Friends interested in health were good.
column7: Could know each other while running and drinking coffee.

column4: Though it was my first time seeing them, everyone had such good personalities and the welcoming vibe was good. Especially when talking after running, we really listened to each other's stories and brought up deep stories, so we could talk like neighborhood friends met with masks from society momentarily removed, which was so good. Seeing good people, I could build up a bit of my collapsed humanity thinking 'the world is still warm (?)'.
column5: The story about being able to overcome trauma by looking at the world excluding the ego was impressive. I always try to put down emotions, and it was a good insight.
column7: Unlike other running crews, it was good to see the effort to deeply understand each other and have conversations. It seemed I could see a value trying to grow mentally as well as physically.
column8: I want to invite~ Five stars!
column10: I don't know yet. But if we exceed a certain number of people in the final conversation, won't it be a bit tiring for this generation with already short attention spans?

column4: It was my first time running with people, so the new experience itself was enjoyable.
column5: I haven't done many activities yet so it's insufficient to answer, but as people from various fields share their experiences, I think I can get various inspirations.
column6: By running together matching speed, I can think once more that I'm not alone but an existence living in a community.
column7: It seems it can be new stimulation (experience) for friends like me who usually like doing things alone.

column4: It was good to be able to run the Namsan trail while having small talk with people I met for the first time. I'm gaining many insights from people working in various fields.
column5: When sharing difficulties felt in life or occupation, I felt many things. There were different yet similar parts. Perhaps because we're similar age, there were many parts I could relate to.
column6: The 'running together' part particularly resonates. It seems sweating and exercising together with people we didn't know before greatly helps break down walls and get to know each other while talking.
column7: I totally want to recommend! I want them to feel that there really are peers who live hard.
column9: I don't know well since it's my first attendance today~
column10: Nature exploration running sessions (nature-friendly activities such as Namsan's hidden rough mountain trails and Bukaksan trail running)

column4: These days I'm totally unemployed so I usually wake up around lunch time, but thanks to P.M.C.C, after a long time I slept early and woke up early and could run in the refreshing Sunday morning air, which was enjoyable. I usually run alone often, and being able to run with many people was a new and satisfying experience.
column5: Meeting new people, realizing I was in quite a narrow pool since there are more diverse occupations and hobbies than I usually encounter.
column7: At first, strangers were awkward, but I most resonated with P.M.C.C's 'deeply understanding each other' in that it becomes a much more natural connection after running together.
column8: For people with extreme I MBTI like me, meeting new people is difficult, but P.M.C.C seems to allow natural blending, so I highly recommend it even for people with I MBTI.
column10: It would be good to have guidance about the course and cafe. It would also be good to run at Han River.

column4: All moments spent together were enjoyable. I like meeting new people and talking, and it was good that I could talk incessantly even while running.
column5: When talking at the cafe...? Being able to hear thoughts of people in different fields rather than colleagues doing the same work...? I came to think again about diversity of thoughts.
column7: Hmm... running together.
column8: Because I want to teach friends who don't enjoy running how to have fun running.
column10: I don't know well yet since it's the first time.

column4: Though I can't run well, I think I ran 5 times what I would have run 1 time thanks to the considerate encouragement from the side. And concern topics or thoughts of people in different fields were interesting (for me who has a narrow social circle with only friends in the same field).
column5: I don't really think deep thoughts (whether good or bad) well, and I'm someone who doesn't do it well, but I came to think that deep conversations or thoughts themselves can make people more vibrant! I came to think about thinking a bit more while living.
column7: The part where through running we break down physical and mental walls and understand the inner self resonates well. Exercise of certain intensity that's somewhat breathless and intense like running seems to naturally make us put down our usual mask-like appearance. By doing so, we start talking with the other person as my real self and it seems good that we start to know each other beginning with each other's real selves.
column8: For me who approaches different people with different personas depending on the person I meet, this place makes me have no persona and my heart becomes more comfortable. I want to invite friends worn out by harsh society.
column10: Uploading vibrant posts like reels. For prospective participants before participation, as a teaser to whet their appetite. For participants, increased re-participation rate through memory recall. (just my simple thought)
